alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 9:39AM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Souris River near Bantry affecting McHenry County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Souris River near Bantry. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1439.7 feet, Flood waters affect farmland or wooded areas in refuge. Due to relative flatness of the area within reach of the gage a rather large area becomes flooded. Damage is to crops and farm buildings. At 1440.2 feet, Water begins crossing the road several hundred feet to the left of the bridge. No towns or major roads are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 1437.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tonight and continue rising to around 1441 feet, which is just above moderate flood stage. The river is forecast to remain near that level through the end of the week. - Flood stage is 1440.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1441.6 feet on 04/09/2017. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
